entry.title: Configuration steps for SMTPs in SAP PO
entry.content:
Hi All,

Recently we have migrated to new SMTPs server and we have completed all the configuration steps in SAP PO for PI Alerts by updating the mail server sender/receiver channels in ID, Also updated the Alert consumer job in NWA. 

We are not receiving any alerts from Alert consumer jobs. Anyone please share the steps for SMTPs configuration guide for the same. 

 

Regards

Abdul

entry.title: Error : Could Not Determine mapping steps for message in SAP PO
entry.content:
Hi Folks,

I have a IDOC -> PI -> SFTP   scenario that I have implemented with an ICO (I'm using PI 7.50).

while testing i am getting the following error.

Transmitting the message to endpoint <local> using connection AFW failed, due to: com.sap.engine.interfaces.messaging.api.exception.MessagingException: Error encountered while executing mapping: com.sap.aii.af.service.mapping.MappingException: com.sap.aii.utilxi.misc.api.ResourceException: Could not determine mapping steps for message 7e24f305-1f9e-11f0-c2e8-00000c37e086

But it works fine in production not in consolidate system.

please check the message logs of particular message

Please help .

Regards,

Ravi

entry.title: error in SFTP receiver channel in SAP 7.50
entry.content:
Hi Team,

My scenario is IDOC to SFTP and authentication is Password authentication.

while sending the data to Target system i am getting the following error.

Transmitting the message to endpoint <local> using connection AFW failed, due to: com.sap.engine.interfaces.messaging.api.exception.MessagingException: javax.resource.ResourceException: java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException: received authentication request from server which could not be processed: destination=user@hostname; name=Password authentication; instruction=prompt=users password

Here user = sftp connecting user

hostname = target host (SFTP SERVER)

 

Please help why i am getting the above error in receiver SFTP channel?

Regards,
Ravi

entry.title: Program RSXMB_DELETE_MESSAGES issue to delete SAP PO tables, deleting almost none
entry.content:
Hello All,

I am using Program RSXMB_DELETE_MESSAGES to delete SAP PO tables in ECC. Goal is to delete all the records from tables SXMSCLUR, SXMSCLUP except for the last 1 month (retention period). We never achieved or deleted any records and currently have around 214 millions of records in these tables. 

The program above RSXMB_DELETE_MESSAGES worked fine in QA system and deleted the records in 5 days but when I ran this program in Production system, it was deleting only 100 records every ~45min which won't help due to the amount of data we have in those tables and how much we process every day.

Below is the screen shot of the job with parameters and the records deleted every loop. 

Can you please help me understand why it is deleting only 100 records every loop(commit) and how it can be increased to 100K or more every commit/loop. FYI, I checked the parameters between my QA and Production systems and they all are same. Appreciate your help. Thanks.

entry.title: SAP PI/PO Dynamic Configuration error while creating an attribute with more than 4096 characters
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

We have a PROXY to REST synchronous interface in SAP PI 7.5 landscape (SP Stack Number 28).

The working of the interface is as follows:

1. SAP sends message to PI via Proxy.
2. PI gets the token via lookup call to an authentication server from Java Mapping.
3. Token is passed to a header field via Dynamic Configuration from Java Mapping.
4. PI then calls the API with the token received through REST Receiver adapter.

This interface has been working smoothly for the last 6 years. But recently we have observed that the token returned by the authentication server has the length around 4100 characters and the interface has stopped working. It is throwing exception in the java mapping while modifying the attribute through dynamic configuration.

Dynamic Configuration part of the Java Mapping:

DynamicConfiguration conf = inputObj.getDynamicConfiguration();

DynamicConfigurationKey key = DynamicConfigurationKey.create("http://sap.com/xi/XI/System/REST","XHeaderName1");

conf.put(key, token);

 

 

Error:

Attempted Solution (not worked):

We already tried to split the token into two parts and write it in two headers (token1 = XHeaderName1 and token2 = XHeaderName2). However, while putting {token1}{token2} in accesstoken header, an error is saying it would expect a value in between {token1} and {token2}.

Please let me know if anyone faced the similar issue earlier and how to resolve this.

entry.title: SAP PI - Group records based on values of the source message
entry.content:
Hi all,

Ive an requirement to group and filter based on the source values:

Ive the following nested Stucture that needs to be mapped/grouped and filtered to the target nested structure:

The Source message can be like this:

And the target XML should look like this:

  • When there is only TestId, the TestId and its Parameter should be passed.
  • When there is both SampleId and TestId, only SampleId should be passed and all the corresponding Parameters of that SampleId should be grouped on. In this case 3 parameters for SampleId (S1) and 1 Parameter for SampleId (S2).
  • Also when there is no TargetId field, the corresponding parameters shouldnt be passed (like parameter P3).

My preference is graphical mapping...
I would be appreciated if you can help me with this, 

Thank you,
John

entry.content:
hello

is rate limiting possible in sap po 7.5?

we have a requirement where we need to restrict number of calls made towards sap webservice .

example if consumer is making more than 1000 calls/hour towards sap .we need to send them back too many request error in response.but this is for only one particular interface not in general for all sap po interface

is it possible to implement such feature in sap po ?

Thanks,
Sahana

entry.title: How do I create a service with SAP PO and NetWeaver using a WSDL from a SOAP 1.2 service?
entry.content:
Hello everyone. I am trying to create a service via SPROXY in my SAP system using a WSDL that is SOAP 1.2. The problem is that no matter how much documentation or guides I look for, I can't get a result. I configured my service this way:


Sender Channel

Receiver Channel

I am performing the test by executing my proxy from SPROXY, calling from the outbound system interface, which in this case is the SAP system, to the SOAP 1.2 service, which is the entity that owns the WSDL.

However, the most persistent error in this case is the following: SOAP: Response message contains an errorXIAdapter/HTTP/ADAPTER.HTTP_EXCEPTION - HTTP 415 Cannot process the message because the content type application/xml was not the expected type application/soap+xml; charset=utf-8.

It's worth adding that the WSDL has certificate authentication (which I possess), but I haven't put it in the receiver channel image yet because I wanted to solve this problem first and then configure the credentials.

I have tried many things to solve this problem:

  1. Creating an XSL mapping for both the request and the response to generate a SOAP 1.2 that would be accepted, but it didn't work (the guide I based this on was the following: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/soap-1-2-protocol-connection-issue-in-sap-po7-5/qaq-p/12331541).

  2. Using HTTP (axis) because it has the SOAP 1.2 option, but when I use that, the error changes to NullPointerException. From here, I investigated and it seems I don't have the axis framework in my SAP PO (NetWeaver 7.50). I tried to install the framework on my own, but I couldn't find a detailed guide to do so, so I couldn't manage it.

  3. Trying other methods of creating this service, but I don't have access to SAP Cloud Process Integration (CPI) or the SOAMANAGER transaction to create an RFC function module. I also tried creating my own service in SICF, but that didn't work either.

Your help would be very useful, especially if it's a step-by-step guide or things to keep in mind. If you need more information, I can gladly provide it, although the only thing I cannot show is the WSDL, as it is my personal information.

As additional information, in ESR, I created data and message types to do the corresponding mapping to the External View, where the outbound sends the request message type to the request external view of the inbound for its mapping, and in turn, this returns the response from the external view to the response message type for the mapping.

I'll be waiting for your response and thank you very much in advance.

entry.content:

eg:

20996_1

<Context Change> (below 2 entries should be increment by 1 and should have same increment value)

20918_1
20919_1
20992_1

I think this can't be achieved with standard functions, please help with UDF to achieve it.

Thanks,

Varun

entry.title: How to carry HTTP error response payloads (e.g., 400, 401) from HTTP_AAE to ABAP server in SOAP-HTTP
entry.content:
Hi,

I am working on a simple integration scenario in SAP PO/PI, and I would appreciate your guidance on how to handle HTTP error payload propagation to the ABAP server.

Scenario:

  • Sender: ABAP system (S/4HANA)

    • Adapter: SOAP Sender

  • Receiver: External HTTP-based API (https://example.com/api)

    • Adapter: HTTP_AAE Receiver

This scenario works perfectly fine when the request payload is valid — the response from the external system is returned to the ABAP system as expected.

Problem:

When the ABAP system sends an invalid request payload (e.g., malformed JSON), the external system responds with an HTTP error status code, such as 400 (Bad Request), along with an error payload/message in the response body.

However:

  • The HTTP_AAE adapter handles these error status codes internally and does not propagate the error payload back to the ABAP server.

  • Instead, the message fails within PO, and the ABAP system does not receive the external system’s error response body, which we would like to see for debugging or logging purposes on the ABAP side.

Attempted Solution:

I created a custom adapter module in hope to access the exception generated within the standard sap.com/com.sap.aii.adapter.http/HttpAdapterBean module and process it accordingly. However, I observed that in the HTTP_AAE adapter’s module chain:

  • The sap.com/com.sap.aii.adapter.http/HttpAdapterBean standard module executes the HTTP call and immediately fails the processing upon receiving an error status code.

  • As a result, any custom module placed after sap.com/com.sap.aii.adapter.http/HttpAdapterBean in the chain does not execute when the HTTP call fails.

This seems to limit the ability to intercept and propagate the error payload to the ABAP server.

Question:

What is the recommended way to achieve the following:
In case of an HTTP error status code (e.g., 400, 401), still capture the external system’s response body and propagate it back to the ABAP server through the synchronous SOAP response?

Specifically:

  • Is there a standard configuration option in HTTP_AAE Adapter to pass the error response back?

  • If not, what is the correct way to extend or override the behavior of the sap.com/com.sap.aii.adapter.http/HttpAdapterBean to allow this?

  • Is writing a custom adapter from scratch really necessary in this case?

Any guidance, best practices, or example implementations would be highly appreciated.

Thank you in advance for your support.

Best regards,
Syed Ijlal Ayub

entry.title: does sap rest adapter(sender channel) in rest polling only read 1 message per poll from a queue
entry.content:
hi experts

I have a Rest Sender channel in Rest Polling mode reading from a ASB (Azure Service Bus) queue via Http endpoint. I am using SAP PO 7.5

i have observed that it reads only one message per poll from queue even though there are multiple messages to read. e.g. if there are 10 messages in queue and channel is polling every 10 seconds, it reads one message in first poll, then 2nd message after 10 seconds and so on. To read all 10 messages it takes 10 polls and 60 seconds in total.

Does the REST adapter work this way? or Is there a way to read all the available messages in queue at once using Rest adapter in Rest Polling mode?

Please suggest or if there is any standard guide which I can refer will be helpful.

Thanks.

Best Regards,

Nidhi Srivastava

entry.title: SAP PO WSSE Security in SOAP adapter
entry.content:
Hi
I am using the SOAP receiver adapter in SAP PO. The webservice i consume needs the Username and Password in the Soap Header like this:

	<soap:Header>
        <wsse:Security soap:mustUnderstand="1" xmlns:wsse="http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-wssecurity-secext-1.0.xsd">
            <wsse:UsernameToken>
                <wsse:Username>xxx</wsse:Username>
                <wsse:Password>yyy</wsse:Password>
            </wsse:UsernameToken>
        </wsse:Security>
      </soap:Header>

How do i do that?
